developerResponse:
{'id': 12214828, 'body': 'Dear Panoptic,
Apologies for the delayed response.
We would like to thank you for taking your valuable time and giving your genuine feedback. You will be glad to know that we are constantly working on improvements.
The content is available offline, you have to download it once and it will stay offline till you have the app installed.

For In-App purchases, we do have limitations based on platforms hence while making the purchase on mobile platforms the pro version is active only on the platform on which the Purchase was made. However we ask our users to contact us via email to activate the Pro version on other platforms, which is done for free.

There are number of offers going on within the app, and we extend the offers on user demand. The countdown might have some issues on the implementation end, we will check and fix it ASAP, thank you for pointing it out.

As for your progress, we would  love to know more details about it to help us understand the issue and work on a solution as soon as possible. 

We appreciate your Time and Efforts to help us make the app better, you can always reach us out at Hello@PrgHub.com for any queries, we will be happy to help :)', 'modified': '2019-12-04T19:19:14Z'}
review:
This app is, an app trying to teach you programming, is riddled with errors. Both in the logic it is trying to teach you and the app it self. 

The app seldom saves your progress. So if you want to do the same lessons over and over again, sure get it. But to me this is annoying and a waste of time I don‚Äôt have. 

Second don‚Äôt buy into their possible UDAAP violating count down on your special deal price for membership. It appears to count down making you think you need to hurry and purchase but give it an hour and go back in and surprise! It‚Äôs reset. Oh also if you want web access too you need to purchase your membership on the web. Buy it through the phone and you won‚Äôt have it. They don‚Äôt tell you that. 

Everything about this app screams scam to me. There are plenty of sites teaching this stuff for either free or cheap and plenty of books in the library. I figured it may be nice to have something on my phone to jog my memory on my commute to work but boy was I wrong. I‚Äôll just bring my kindle as well.

review:
My dream job(BTW, I‚Äôm 10,) is to become a programmer! I want to help with the advancement of medicine. But, I thought that programming language was hard to understand, or complicated, with all those tags and everything. I‚Äôve tried some things. Did not work very well. So, I one day decided to browse through the App Store, bored, finding what could be right for me. But then, this app caught my very eye.

I thought that this app was another boring old app that is just like any other; repetitive, boring, and unteachable. But, I got it anyway, to see how it worked out. And do you want to know what I thought? This is actually fun and educational!

It breaks lessons thoroughly and easy. It gives you a mini lesson about that sub-lesson to that big lesson on this giant app. You guys made this app fun! I‚Äôm learning JavaScript, and it breaks it up step by step. No wonder it has so many 5 star ratings!

There is a little room for improvement. For example, where is intermediate? You go from beginner to advance. Where is that? There is no in between! Also, you could make more categories. It‚Äôs just tedious finding the course you want. Then, if you can‚Äôt find it, you have to search it, and what if you can‚Äôt remember the name! Please consider this as constructive feedback and not critical.

Anyways, back to the pros. Love the pictures to go along with it! It really helps with the research part if you wanna do apple or AI or C++ and so forth!

So, I love this app, and please make more!
Peace out-
Brock Lytle(RedDogRunning)
title: Hello!

review:
This app just isn‚Äôt Good, with a capital G. In fact, I think it is Bad. I mean in a metaphysical sense, this app ultimately has Bad intentions. 

Sure, it wears a Good mask with its wonderfully design mask that gives you a hug after its pleasantly displayed dialogue about what programming is (not how to do it), and sure, there seems to be a great deal of 34.99 for lifetime access so you won‚Äôt get billed ever again. That also seems Good. There‚Äôs a broad range of courses so you can learn *about* whatever you like. That also seems Good. 

And then you try to learn, which can only theoretically occur after we have finished the free ‚Äúwhat is Programming‚Äù lessons. There‚Äôs a reason for this, because the learning is literally clicking answers to a quiz, where you can always just change your answer and speed through. No *learning* takes place anywhere. No practical example. No code editor. No hint that we‚Äôre only here to learn about concepts, and pretty basic ones, from my C# experience. 

Would you have paid 34.95 for such a thing? Maybe you would have, but my thinking is you probably wanted to learn something instead of being hugged by your hand computer. 

Oh, maybe their c# class is only in development? Not according to other reviews here. 

Get this app if you want to relate to your children/grandchildren about what programming is, or maybe if you want to be a terrible CEO who ruins his company because he thinks he learned something. 

You lesson designers‚Ä¶ I know you understand. I know it‚Äôs the bizdev creature. They‚Äôre gonna do what they‚Äôre gonna do. 

I know it‚Äôs not your fault either, overworked marketing person who is probably underpaid as well. 

But this product‚Ä¶ and it is a product‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs Bad. It hurts people by being deceptive more than it does by being ineffective, and it‚Äôs designed to do just that. That‚Äôs not Good, by whatever moral system you use. If it is considered good, I don‚Äôt know what to think of your higher power, man.
title: Not Good

review: The app gets across the basics, and maybe provides a starting point to learn more advanced things elsewhere, but that's pretty much it. You don't get any hands-on experience like with many other apps so you'll have to look for actual practice elsewhere. The English is okay at best (or atrocious at worst in some cases), making some lessons hard to follow or difficult to understand for a person who has never seriously coded. I think if you're already learning to code then this could be a good review app though. However, overall not terribly impressed.

review:
I‚Äôm really fed up with this app at this point. I complete a course it crashes every time. This time it took my progress for every single course I was enrolled in and multiple certifications from passed courses. Great information in the app and I like the layout. I don‚Äôt like that I paid for a pro membership for an app that can‚Äôt deliver on its basic premise of allowing someone to get additional certifications Update: Heard back from customer service who says it just ‚Äúhappens sometimes‚Äù and that everything will come back if I delete and reinstall the app, which is literally what I said I did as soon as it happened. It‚Äôs been multiple days, it‚Äôs pretty clear this won‚Äôt magically come back and I guess I‚Äôm out $35 and multiple certifications I paid for. Don‚Äôt recommend. App may literally wipe everything and then customer service may not read your email and say that I should just keep waiting even after days of it being broken. ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø Update: 7/25/2021 Contacting support has been worthless. The issue consistently keeps getting responded with ‚Äúyour certs will just return‚Äù I‚Äôve now asked for a refund and if I don‚Äôt get one I‚Äôm calling my card and clawing back the charge. I‚Äôve basically been run around in circles for about a month and any ‚Äúfixes‚Äù they‚Äôve said they‚Äôve added has only made the situation worse. Now when I refresh the app it removes courses I‚Äôm enrolled in. Don‚Äôt buy this app. They don‚Äôt seemingly care about the quality issues in the app or customer service they have.
Update 8/1 - I think the additional canned messages from the developer asking me to reach out to the customer service team, the one that‚Äôs not been fixing my issue for over a month and making the situation worse is telling. Having working in CS I‚Äôm seeing no good processes here for proper escalations or handling of issues that have clearly gotten out of hand for a customer. It means there‚Äôs no actual fix coming nor do they actually care to track down the lengthy ticket thread and escalate it to someone who knows how to resolve the issue. My name here and in the ticket are the same, it wouldn‚Äôt take long for someone to search for it in zendesk. But I have no intentions of jumping back onto that wheel of pain when it‚Äôs abundantly clear your agents have already attempted everything and refuse to simply escalate me at this point. 
Again I do not recommend this app. Their lack of quality in CS and the bugs in the app are not worth it. Even if they give you a major discount.

review: After testing MANY similar apps I was thrilled to find this to be exactly what I wanted. It has a large selection of topics and allows me to go at my own pace without having to sit and listen or watch videos. I had no problem paying for the subscription, but so glad I decided to try a month before investing in the lifetime purchase. Out of the 17 courses I have completed, it is only registering 1. It crashes 10 times in a row before allowing me to enter a course. Once I get into the course, I have to restore my pro purchase because it forgets every time I exit. After contacting the developer for assistance, my ticket was closed because I could not answer the numerous ridiculous questions I was asked. There is a problem with your app, you need to fix it, you should not ignore paying customers with concerns. I want to learn to code so I can help you fix these frustrating issues!!!! Ugh!

review:
Programming Hub itself is buggy and I understand it is in Beta at the moment and hope it improves because it is great and offers a variety of courses which i love about it but expect problems or bugs.

Sometimes it wont connect on app or on web. Bought lifetime pro, and system will tell me its valid for 1 year. Customer support fixed the issue but next time i check its back to expiring in 1 year. If your using on different devices your progress will jump all over the place for example after completing a course and getting a certificate you may go on to your other device and it will show your course isnt completed on 1 or more courses completed already at 100% it will say 91% completed, after completing again you gain a duplicate certificate. At some points with very little explanation it can make a whole lesson confusing for example coding a web page and the lesson tells you to insert a certain code or edit part of the code but doesnt say where it belongs or where it needs to be changed in script as your trying to code yourself following instructions given by lesson.

As much as I love learning on this app, I have gotten tired of the bugs and they aren‚Äôt just 1 or 2 bugs but quite a few but until they are fixed I will be using use Grasshopper and Code Academy which have also taught me just as much in coding but offer fewer courses then Programming Hub.

review: If you are intimidated and/or confused by the tools out there for learning to code (like I was) then this is the perfect place to start.  It may seem to be babying you a little bit at first but this is the best way to learn the foundations of programming.  You must pick up all of the basics and you cannot succeed if you try to learn everything at once.  For these reasons, this is really the perfect place to start when taking on the challenge of learning to code.
